title: Is it just me or does adc feel like a subpar role this season?
body:
Im making this thread because i would like to compare how im feeling about the current state of the adc role with other players since season 10 changed the way i see it so drasticaly. I apologize for any typos and other errors in advance.


For starters id like to clarify that im fine with adc's no longer being the "carry" role but with how restrictive the marksman champion class became there is actualy very little to do in order to adapt to the new meta...  quite franky a lot of the marksman champions seem completly unviable due to how easily it is to kill them right now and how hard is to not fall of while playing them, either you pick an adc that can somehow run for safety or you are a walking gold sac for the enemy to plunder.

I also noticed that people in my games seem to be aware of that, supports tend to go for damage oriented mages much more often than traditional supports and its quite common for them to outdamage their adc's even thou they have much less gold. sometimes people dont even bother picking an adc botlane and go with a duo mage bot or some speficic combo for synergy. peeling doesnt even exist in current lol terminology... either the adc survives by himself or dies by himself even if its in the middle of a teamfight.

in the end my games wiith adc feel like im playing a champion ballanced for being a glass cannon but only functional as a bait. either ill do no mistakes and mantain some sort of relevance... or with a single mistake ill fall behind for far that there is just no place on the map for me. 

And i have actualy tried to do the same think as my opponents did and pick some mages bot which seems to actualy confirm my assumpions. Picking something like syndra bot allowed me to simply click on enemy adc to score some easy gold, i diidnt run out of mana trying to farm and push the lane. all of this while i didnt have to worry that if i wont hoard gold like a madman ill fall out of relevance

replies.body:
Marksmen rely on their supports throughout the entire lane and midgame, and their team in late game.

Up until a few seasons ago, most supports were focused on team utility, shields, peeling and buffing, ever since {{champion:555}} and {{champion:235}}  tho, i see more and more supports just ditch the word "support" out of their role and just play 2nd assassin/marksmen.

We had this in earlier seasons too with mages, but even those Mages offered some forms of peel or utility (Annie AoE stun, Lux snare + slow + shield, Brand stun + slow after {{item:3116}}) But when i look at {{champion:235}} , nothing about her tells me "okay, i can rely on her to have my back in a fight" because they 90% of the time dont, they build full lethality, use their Q to damage and ult to snipe kills, while not even sharing gold like pyke.

I guess it's fine, supports can play w/e they want, but they also need to realise that would usually mean their marksmen will be behind in match ups where the enemy marksmen has an actual support ({{champion:111}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:117}}  etc..).
Bonus points of your team has 0 tanks and all assassins/squishy fighters and hide behind you while taking objectives, then flame you when you the entire enemy team jumps on you, because even if you're 0-5-4 you'll be the easiest target in the game (excluding SOME marksmen).

What a champion build doesn't make up for what they are.
Some clear example would be sona and yuumi (pre-change) who both build damage item but weren't truly mage (they had no waweclear) and still acted like an enchanter with some dmg.
That is because it's their kit saying that and not the build (eg heal/shield, ms boost, and a CC)
Senna is like sona except with a bit more damage.
She has still an shield,heal and a cc which are some traditional support ability and even if she pick only lethality item ({{item:3179}}  which is also support item since vision control is a job that support has already done in the past {{item:2055}} {{item:3364}} ) she still has that heal and shield and that cc, they don't just stop existing, they're weaker but they're still there.
Pyke design is somewhat made so he can be another hooker with risky plays and better reward.
Calling pyke a not support is like calling {{champion:53}} {{champion:412}} not support.
Hook was suppose to punish low hp target (ADC on particular) and also offer hard ingage.
Also support can be roamer (the whole existence of pyke W) and his E is a cc.
The only thing that doesn't make any sense it's his execute because it is suppose to be a carry ability (probably it should have been a diver ability) but riot put a gold bag so they make it.
In my opinion those two champ are at the same level of utility of a {{champion:25}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:43}}  and if they are support because they have Cc,dmg and a shield then why senna who has a heal or shield should make the difference?
Morgana,lux,sona are all support who build dmg item and still have peeling as senna.
Xerath,vel'koz,brand (if it wasn't for his passive then he would not be played here since his kit is based on AoE),zyra are not traditional support because despite they have some cc, the entire point on their kit is based on having base dmg and that's it, they deal dmg.

I guess ill make my point more clear, Pyke and Senna give their players the solo carry mindset, which is fine - im not trying to tell them how to play, just telling how it effects the adc.

If my pyke ignores me in teamfights and plays like an assassin, then i have no support,  i have an assassin with a support item, which means that in teamfights i, as an adc, have to peel for myself (unlike if i had a Naut or a Lulu).
Adc is very relied on his team and especially support to help him survive teamfights, if my Senna is building full lethality and playing like a 2nd marksmen, then again, im on my own.

this has been somewhat the same when you get a Lux or Brand support, but to me it seems like Pyke and Senna amplified that "solo carry support" niche by a lot.
its just you the subpar role is jg.

Its just that mid is insanely OP in SoloQ (uncoordinated environment).  Games are decided by better midlaner, jungler is now just  a cannon minion post 3 minutes, and the game is over by 10 minutes.  No chance for top lane or bot lane to influence the game.  Only role worth playing is mid.
One shotting is still too strong, which makes game, not just adc feel bad.

Yeah so when i choose in lobby ADC/TOP or ADC/JUNGLE i get ADC in maybe 3/10 For sure this role doesnt strong. And i forget that ppl arent even auto fill to support but top or jungle... hmmm interesting

ADC it's fine, neither great or horrible.

Just fine.

Adc depends on their supports to do well (especially in laning phase).

If your support is garage good luck.

Also do yourself a favor and perma ban Naut when playing adc.
Naut or Pyke
Why? Sure hit box on q is big but so is blitz and neither can pass through cs, better off banning leo cause she has more cc and can pass through cs

Because naut has a fuck you button on R on top of all the other bullshit he brings.

That champ is too braindead for how much he can zone a carry from the fight.
Sooo leo does what he does but better and blitz does the samething

>Sooo leo does what he does but better and blitz does the samething

Didn’t know Leona range ult stun was point and click.

And that blitz has any CC besides a hook and melee auto attack.

Blitz has a huge AOE silence, point and click knockup, and a skillshot hook.

Leona has an AOE slow / stun, point and click stun, skillshot root.

Leona can follow up her point and click stun with her ult making it unmissable.

1. The aoe silence doesn’t mean shit, it is not hard CC.

2. That point and click knockup is a melee auto attack.

3. Naut has a skillshot hook too, whats your point?

You are also missing the damn point with leona.

Try again.
Leona is just straight up better than nautilus at locking down a target.

Except for the fact that the only cc you can’t outplay is her melee range Auto attack stun? (Which shouldn’t happen before any of her other CC unless she has flash)

An adc can teammate fight while Leona E and R are ready because they have the potential to be outplayed. And for insurance a QSS is nice to have.


But Naut? His ult range is bigger than  the majority (if not all)  marksmen auto attack ranges, even if you wait for him to burn his hook, you still can’t fight because of that point n click ult of his.

QSS won’t help either thanks to it being a knockup : )

Leona may have better damage, but naut can easily single out a carry without putting any effort into it.
Leona's CC lasts longer and is shorter CD. Even if she doesn't E Q R she can still R before and the 80% slow guarantee's  her E hits. Naut R can be played around by simply peeling back.

I honestly do not care how long leona can CC when i already pointed out that her kit can be out played.

Naut R can not be outplayed and good luck peeling back with whatever random comp or teammates solo queue has to throw at you.

I don’t know what else needs to be said to get it through your thick skull that naut is a braindead champ that has an easier time making sure the adc doesn’t get to play the game compared to the others, but I’m done at this point.

> [{quoted}](name=2Charmnot2Charm,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vHKyNyw8,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2020-01-26T14:27:28.403+0000)
>
> Adc depends on their supports to do well (especially in laning phase).
> 
> If your support is garage good luck.
> 
> Also do yourself a favor and perma ban Naut when playing adc.

the point i was trying to make is that quite often i see some people just take a mage as a suppport... and the adc doesnt come close to what they can do even though the adc has much more gold. yet you wont see the same ppower imballance if you both get mages on botlane.

> quite franky a lot of the marksman champions seem completly unviable due to how easily it is to kill them right now

hmm maybe because if they weren't easily killable then they would mow down teams with fun and skillful ranged crit autos

ADC's depend too much on their team and their support to be effective in soloque tbh. Especially when 90% of solo que supports play champions without peel and even worse if they play another back line champion. God I hate when the support plays a ranged champion. Makes the game literally unplayable. Even if I'm mid it's tilting seeing a mage support on my team.

Sub par as in worse then the solo lanes and support sure. 
Sub par is in actively bad? nah

Are you complaining about Bot ROLE or marksman CLASS?

I am not sure I understand

> [{quoted}](name=Saezio,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vHKyNyw8,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2020-01-26T14:59:22.143+0000)
>
> Are you complaining about Bot ROLE or marksman CLASS?
> 
> I am not sure I understand

I think that its the marksman class... since you can just take a mage and do the botlane role much better. seems like every role is just ballanced around the fact that they can kill the marksman to the point where marksman tends to lose to everyone. I practicaly started seeing that people in game treat marksmen as some free gold that just roams the map

IDK, there are always some marksmen that are doing too well and the others are left in their misery.

ATM aphelios Senna MF ashe and vayne are in really good spots. Draven mains always find ways to make the champ work. Lucian is also not bad by any means (49,5% winrate BUT like 23% pickrate according to u.gg for 10.1 in diamond)

The rest are kinda waiting their turn. Cait was real strong in the past patches for example.

It´s not so much marksmen as a whole as it is specific ones being much better in this meta where engage supports like Leo are prominent.


Right now the most obvious winner in this situation is MF, she loves having a CC heavy champ sit on some target to keep them stuck so she can make it rain bullets without a care.

And it shows on her play,pick and even her banrates-


But others like Lucian, Jhin, Ashe and even Draven do not find this to be an unfavorable meta, they also like to have a support who does heavy engages that locks someone down for them.
Just you

> [{quoted}](name=Disco Swiss,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vHKyNyw8,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2020-01-26T15:41:44.775+0000)
>
> The only marksmen in my elo i ever see do well are the ones with some sort of mobility. {{champion:145}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:67}} 
> 
> Even if an immobile but powerful adc gets fed in lane.. it's super underwhelming.
> 
> I personally dont know why anyone would play marksmen when champs like
> {{champion:238}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:875}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:141}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:555}} 
> Exist and have a built in "out play adc" button.

this is kinda why i made this thread... i had a lot of lanes where i managed to get fed ... and even if i went 8/0 on  the pre nerf aphelios who should be a powerhouse... i still struggled to even come close to a teamfight cause a stray skillshot could totaly destroy me (a single "e" from an ulting shywana takes between 50 and 75% of adc's hp)... i enjoy playing marksmen the most out all champion classes but now it seems to be a recipe for defeat especialy when you take into account that your own support can just take a mage and outdo you in every way while having much less gold

It's not just you. Adc is less impactfull overall. The nerf to duo-experience makes it harder for adc to hit their powerspike where they start becoming super impactfull. Additionally drake fights are more important than ever before.

Some high-elo players in korea currently play taliyah botlane very successfully. Just because it's a champion that is strong in early game.
I pick vayne so that my boosted bonobo support  wont hold me back
It’s because adc is less impactful. You don’t come online until the game is already over and you’re even more under leveled than normal with the Xp gutting.

Just you. ADCs are still burst-per-second ranged assassins, now more than ever with how busted Energized items are. Their builds are also among the most flexible of any role, with entire items built around invalidating tanks and low-mobility juggernauts {{item:3153}} {{item:3036}} /{{item:3033}}  while still having three item slots for their burst damage.

>peeling doesnt even exist in current lol terminology... either the adc survives by himself or dies by himself even if its in the middle of a teamfight.

That's... bullshit. As long as you can position yourself well ofc.

I'm a Thresh, Ali, Rakan, Leo, Naut and Pyke main, and they all can provide just godlike peel/engage. For example Zed, Talon, Katarina, and most assasins simply can't do much vs these champs peel, and that's just a fact. {{champion:555}} also peels quite decent. If they're all dead, they can't touch ur adc, right? /s

Anyway you've got no idea how many times I've 2v8 with my adc by simply peeling them. {{item:3050}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3109}} {{item:3107}}{{item:2065}}{{item:3222}}  also helps a lot. Don't forget that supports can body block most skillshots as well!

Based on my several years of experience as a support only player, this statement just seems... so wrong lol

You either have bad supports, "supports", but only by name, or you simply don't know how to position well

i dont dispute that peeling is not possible... i dispute that people actualy do it... because in my games suports usualy focus primarily on locking down the enemy carry rather than protecting their own... which makes me feel like noone is even expecting the adc to deal the damage that would justify protecting him
